current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To delay the application of the Patient Protection and
		  Affordable Care Act.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text:
Delay in application of
			 Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law,
			 any provision of (including any amendment made by) the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Patient Protection and
			 Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that is otherwise scheduled to take effect on or after January 1,
			 2014, shall not take effect until the date that is one year after the date on
			 which such provision would otherwise have been scheduled to take effect.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2011/t:I

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subtitle B of title
			 II of the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2011
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2011/t:II/st:B

header.#text:
One-year delay
			 in PPACA provisions scheduled to take effect on or after January
			 1, 2014

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law,
			 in the case of any tax which is imposed or increased by any provision of
			 (including any amendment made by) the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Patient Protection and Affordable Care
			 Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, if such tax
			 or increase takes effect before January 1, 2014, such tax or increase shall not
			 apply during the 1-year period beginning on such date.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2011/t:I

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subtitle B of title II of the Health
			 Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2011
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2011/t:II/st:B

header.#text:
One-year
			 suspension of certain tax increases already in effect

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1490 IS: To delay the application of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
